1.text: For this reason, I, Paul, am the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles!

2.text: Surely, you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given to me toward you;

3.text: how by revelation, he made known to me the mystery, as I wrote before in a few words.

4.text: When you read them, you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ,

5.text: which in other generations was not made known to anyone as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit.

6.text: [I mean] that the Gentiles are [now] fellow heirs and fellow members of the body, yes, fellow partakers of God’s promise in Christ through the Good News.

7.text: Of this Good News, I was made a servant, according to the gift of God’s grace which was given me according to the working of his power.

8.text: This grace was given to me, the very least of all saints, so that I might preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable treasures of Christ

9.text: and make everyone see the dispensation of the mystery which had been hidden in God for so long, in him who created all things through Jesus Christ.

10.text: This happened so that now, through the Church, the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places,

11.text: according to the eternal purpose which God had in Christ Jesus our Lord,

12.text: in whom we have boldness and confident access through our faith in him.

13.text: Therefore, I ask that you do not lose heart because of my troubles for you, as they are your glory!

14.text: And so, I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,

16.text: asking that according to the riches of his glory, he would grant you to be inwardly strengthened with power through his Spirit.

17.text: I also pray that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith, so that you may be rooted and grounded in love.

18.text: May you [thus] be strengthened to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and depth and height

19.text: of Christ’s love which is beyond knowledge; and that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

20.text: Now to him who is able to accomplish much more than all we can ask or think according to the power that works in us,

21.text: to him be the glory in the Church by Christ Jesus to all generations, unto ages of ages. Amen.
